com.communote.server.core.common.caching

Class Cache

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.core.common.caching.Cache
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EhCache, NoCache

    public abstract class Cache
extends Object
    An abstract cache providing basic caching features. The get method follows a self-populating strategy.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

      Cache()

        public Cache()

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public <K extends CacheKey,T extends Serializable> T get(K key,
                                                         AccessRestrictedCacheElementProvider<K,T> provider)
                                                  throws AuthorizationException
        This method checks the access for the given item, before it returns it.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of the key
        T - the type of the cached element
        Parameters:
        key - the key to use
        provider - The provider for asserting access and loading the requested element in case it is not cached.
        Returns:
        the cached element or null if the element provider returned null or threw a CacheElementProviderException
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - Thrown, if the user has no access to the given item.

      • get

        public <K extends CacheKey,T extends Serializable> T get(K key,
                                                         CacheElementProvider<K,T> provider)
        Retrieves an element identified by the provided key from the cache. In case this element is not yet cached it will be cached after loading it from the element provider. If the element provider cannot provide the requested element nothing will be cached.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of the key
        T - the type of the cached element
        Parameters:
        key - the key to use
        provider - the provider for loading the requested element in case it is not cached
        Returns:
        the cached element or null if the element provider returned null or threw a CacheElementProviderException

      • handleGet

        protected abstract CacheElementWrapper<Serializable> handleGet(String cacheKey)
                                                        throws CacheException
        Retrieves an element identified by the provided key from the cache.
        Parameters:
        cacheKey - the key used for storing the element in the cache
        Returns:
        the cached element or null if there is no element cached that has the supplied cacheKey or the cached element is expired
        Throws:
        CacheException - when there are problems with the backend

      • handleInvalidate

        protected abstract void handleInvalidate(String cacheKey)
                                  throws CacheException
        Invalidates the data stored under the supplied key.
        Parameters:
        cacheKey - the key used for caching
        Throws:
        CacheException - when the invalidation failed

      • handlePut

        protected abstract void handlePut(String cacheKey,
                                  CacheElementWrapper<Serializable> cacheElement,
                                  int timeToLive)
                           throws CacheException
        Stores an element under the key cacheKey in the cache.
        Parameters:
        cacheKey - the key used for caching and retrieving
        cacheElement - the element to be cached; never null
        timeToLive - the time in seconds until the item will expire. A negative value indicates eternal caching.
        Throws:
        CacheException - when caching failed

      • invalidate

        public <K extends CacheKey,T extends Serializable> void invalidate(K key,
                                                                   CacheElementProvider<K,T> provider)
                                                            throws CacheException
        Invalidates a cached element that has the key cacheKey.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of the key
        T - the type of the cached element
        Parameters:
        key - the key to use
        provider - the associated provider
        Throws:
        CacheException - when the invalidation failed

      • invalidateAll

        public void invalidateAll(CacheElementProvider<?,?> provider)
        Invalidate all cached items that were retrieved from the given provider. Note: this will invalidate the cached items of all clients
        Parameters:
        provider - the provider from which the cached items to be invalidated were loaded

      • invalidateAllOfCurrentClient

        public void invalidateAllOfCurrentClient(CacheElementProvider<?,?> provider)
        Invalidate all cached items that were retrieved from the given provider.
        Parameters:
        provider - the provider from which the cached items to be invalidated were loaded

      • put

        public <K extends CacheKey,T extends Serializable> void put(K key,
                                                            CacheElementProvider<K,T> provider,
                                                            T data)
                                                     throws CacheException
        Stores some data in the cache under the provided key.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of the key
        T - the type of the data to be cached
        Parameters:
        key - the key to use
        provider - the associated provider
        data - the data to be cached; can be null
        Throws:
        CacheException - when caching failed
